author: Charles Shepherd
title: Orlando International Airport Takes A Bow Following A Year Of Awards And Recognitions
text:
Orlando International Airport Takes A Bow Following A Year Of Awards And Recognitions
ORLANDO, Fla. — This may be the season of giving, but Orlando International Airport (MCO) has been fortunate to have been on the receiving end of notable accolades spanning the entire year. Various organizations, publications and groups have recognized MCO for its achievements, facilities and personnel. While the awards ranged from the prestigious to the esoteric, the Board and staff of the Greater Orlando Aviation Authority (GOAA) celebrate every one.
With a focus on delivering a unique travel experience for more than 56 million annual passengers, Orlando International was proud to be recognized by the World Travel Awards as North America’s Leading Airport. Other awards for overall excellence included: Best Airport for Recreation by Global Traveler magazine and Best Family-Friendly Domestic Airport from WhereverFamily.com.
Terminal C, the largest project in airport history, received a host of engineering, construction and design awards:
• Project of the Year by Airport Business Magazine. The award was based on innovation, vision, impact and collaboration with key partners including HNTB, Fentress Architects, Burns Engineering, Hensel Phelps, and Turner Construction.
• Top Project of the Year — Engineering News-Record (ENR) Southeast.
• Excellence in Construction Project of the Year from the Central Florida Chapter of Associated Builders and Contractors (ABC).
• Eagle Award in Infrastructure from the Central Florida Chapter ABC.
• A+ Award from Architizer, an organization that spotlights architects and designers.
Another key sector where MCO stood out was sustainability. With attention to energy usage and water management practices, along with adhering to stricter building and materials standards, GOAA was lauded for its efforts with the following distinctions:
• Benjamin J. Siwinski Sustainability Award for Terminal C
• U.S. Green Building Council (USBC) Sustainability Technology Award — Terminal C
• USBC Marquee Green Building Legacy Award — Train Station
• Green Apple Environment Awards International Bronze Award for Terminal C
2023 has also been a year of accomplishments for Aviation Authority leadership. GOAA Chief Executive Officer Kevin Thibault was recognized as one of Orlando Business Journal’s 2023 C-Suite Honorees. He was also named one of Orlando Magazine’s “50 Most Powerful People of 2023.” Routes World, an international organization that supports the air transport industry, presented Chief Development Officer Vicki Jaramillo with the 2023 Individual Leadership Award. The GOAA Finance team, led by Chief Financial Officer Kathleen Sharman, received the Certificate of Excellence in Financial Reporting from the Government Finance Officers Association. Gary Trotta, Assistant VP of Operations at Orlando Executive Airport, was named to Airport Business Magazine’s 40 Under 40 list.
There were also a handful of atypical, yet still appreciated, recognitions:
• Best Carpet — Orlando Weekly
• Best Digital Signage for Public Spaces — Digital Signage Experience (DIZZIE)
• Favorite Airport Shopping — trazeetravel.com, a publication written for and by travelers ages 25-40
• Best Sit-Down Restaurants for Travelers – No. 2: Cask & Larder — USA Today
• Best Workplaces for Commuters — Center for Urban Transportation Research
And most recently, at the Airports Council International North America annual conference for Communications, Marketing and Customer Experience, MCO staff received first place honors in the Print Communications category for producing a commemorative book celebrating the opening of Terminal C.
The Greater Orlando Aviation Authority is proud to operate Orlando International Airport (MCO) and Orlando Executive Airport (ORL), two of Florida’s premier air travel gateways. MCO is a world-class global connector, serving more than 50 million annual passengers in its Main Terminal and Terminal C. Connected to an Intermodal Terminal Facility, Terminal C is an inventive structure that elevates the customer experience with 100% automated screening lanes at TSA checkpoints. ORL is conveniently located just miles from downtown Orlando and provides vital general aviation access to the heart of the region

author: EFE
title: Cinco escuelas de Acapulco suspenden clases tras ola de violencia en este puerto mexicano - Mundo - ABC Color
text: Mundo Cinco escuelas de Acapulco suspenden clases tras ola de violencia en este puerto mexicano Acapulco (México), 9 abr (EFE).- Cinco escuelas del puerto mexicano de Acapulco anunciaron este miércoles que han suspendido clases o las han hecho virtuales tras una ola de violencia que incluye asesinatos e incendios de negocios, presuntamente por parte del crimen organizado. Por EFE 09 de abril de 2025 - 18:13

author: Alexander Mitchell
title: United Airlines' Digital Wheelchair Sizing Tool Improves Travel Experience
text:
Quick Links
For those with mobility disabilities, traveling can be far more challenging than one might expect, as there are very few industry tools available that allow one to understand what aircraft may be able to accommodate wheelchairs and mobility devices. United Airlines, however, attempted to address many of these challenges when it launched its wheelchair sizing tool earlier this year, hoping to expand accessibility by providing passengers with a quick way to understand which aircraft will be able to fit their mobility devices.
Get all the latest
[aviation news](/tag/aviation-news/)
from Simple Flying! For months now, United Airlines passengers have been able to examine whether their wheelchairs will be able to fit onboard an aircraft they are going to fly on during the booking process, providing them with a simple way to explore their accessibility options. As expected, the new system has significantly improved the travel experience for those who require mobility accommodations, as per the latest data released by United.
According to statistics from the airline, more than 20,000 customers have already used the industry-leading tool since it was launched towards the end of April 2024. The carrier has also been able to incorporate the results of dozens of feedback surveys, allowing it to improve its customer satisfaction ratings by nearly 4%.
A new strategic partnership
United also announced today that it would be launching a new collaboration with the United Spinal Association, hoping that the organization will be able to leverage its expertise to
best support the carrier with its accessibility initiatives. United's leadership team has been quick to note its excitement following today's announcement, with Dan Kinzelman, the carrier's Chief Commercial Officer, sharing the following words:
"The early success of our digital sizing tool is an encouraging development in our ongoing efforts to find more ways to improve the travel experience for customers of all abilities."
The executive also added his excitement about United's new collaboration with the United Spinal Association, praising the organization's ability to develop impactful solutions. Furthermore, Kinzelman indicated that he looked forward to utilizing the valuable feedback to better meet the needs of United customers.
The carrier's new wheelchair tool was also introduced alongside a new policy that allowed customers to seek a refund if they were forced to pay for a more expensive flight to accommodate their wheelchair. Other recent United accessibility initiatives include all the following:
- Providing ramp agents with mobile technology that allows them to follow specific instructions for loading wheelchairs
- The airline was the first US carrier to add Braille to aircraft interiors
- United seatback screens feature an array of accessibility features, including closed captions
The United Spinal Association is equally excited by the launch of this new partnership
As one of America's leading organizations that supports individuals with mobility disabilities, the United Spinal Association is excited to begin helping United deliver on many of its sustainability objectives.
In a statement, Vincenzo Piscopo, the CEO and President of the organization, said as follows:
"I am thrilled about this collaboration with United Airlines. I commend their commitment to making the travel experience more accessible for people with disabilities and their decision to choose United Spinal Association as a partner in this journey."
Piscopo went on to add that this partnership demonstrates a major step being taken towards making accessible travel a reality. Furthermore, the executive noted that every additional collaboration of this kind will continue to help improve the travel experience for those with mobility disabilities.
[Related ](/southwest-damages-basketball-team-wheelchairs/) [ Southwest Airlines Accused Of Damaging Wheelchair Basketball Team's Chairs Before Tournament ](/southwest-damages-basketball-team-wheelchairs/)
The carrier has since made sure disabled customers have a better experience in the future.

author: 20minutos
title: "Piñas despeluchadas", pasillos vacíos y muchas bromas: la moda viral de ligar en el supermercado no cala en los ciudadanos
text: Son las 19.00 horas de un jueves y algunos tímidos compradores se pasean tranquilos por un Mercadona del centro de Madrid. Parece que la moda de ir a encontrar pareja al conocido supermercado no ha calado hondo. El pasillo de los vinos está vacío y tres tristes piñas en la sección de fruta evidencian haber sido utilizadas para algún vídeo viral. \u0022La gente viene a hacer el tonto, a grabarse, y nos fastidian el género. Me quedan tres piñas despeluchadas de que las pongan en el carro dadas la vuelta\u0022, sentencia uno de los trabajadores con resignación. Ningún comprador lleva la famosa fruta, que supone indicar estar dispuesto a ligar, ni siquiera una bolsa de lechuga, que hace referencia, por su corto periodo de caducidad, a que se quiere un rollo de una noche. El meme y la broma se han extendido. \u0022Nos han salido muchas cosas por Internet\u0022, dicen Antonio y Oto, de 18 años, que justo pasan por la puerta del comercio hablando de la reciente técnica de cortejo. \u0022No hemos venido, tampoco por curiosidad\u0022, señalan entre risas mientras uno de ellos dice tener novia. \u0022Esto es una tendencia más de TikTok, el mejor sitio para ligar es en clase, el trabajo, fiestas... la noche sobre todo\u0022. Estos vídeos de redes sociales ligando en el supermercado han llegado incluso hasta gente de la tercera edad. María Luisa y María Teresa, dos hermanas de 82 y 81 años, se saben de carrerilla todo lo que hay que hacer para conseguir un ligue en Mercadona. \u0022Nos ha salido en la tele o en Google. No nos interesa nada, estamos fuera de todo esto...\u0022, explican a la vez que no pueden aguantar la risa. Ambas creen que la tendencia \u0022es una tontería\u0022 después de haber vivido esos matrimonios de los que duran toda la vida. \u0022Llevo 62 años casada. Ahora todo es con fecha de caducidad\u0022, detalla María Luisa. Su hermana, ya viuda, dice echar de menos a su marido pero lanza un mensaje a los jóvenes de que: \u0022No os atéis. Hay que vivir la vida\u0022. \u0022Cualquier sitio es bueno para ligar\u0022 Para Beto (53 años), que atiende a 20minutos cargado de bolsas, barra de pan incluida, todo lo que se está formando alrededor del tema \u0022es muy gracioso\u0022 y aunque reconoce que no ha entrado \u0022a saco\u0022 porque siempre va a lo suyo haciendo la compra, lo deja muy claro: \u0022Cualquier sitio es bueno para ligar\u0022. Beto aún no se ha familiarizado con los famosos códigos (\u0022me tengo que enterar\u0022), ni domina bien el lenguaje del amor en el supermercado, pero cree que sería ideal que la técnica de ligar se quedara para siempre y no se olvidara. \u0022Me parecería maravilloso\u0022, apunta sin parar de reír. Para los que tienen pareja las cosas son algo distintas. Al ser preguntados por el tema no dudan en señalar que están pillados. \u0022Suelo comprar en Mercadona a esa hora, pero no tenía la menor idea de que se hacía esto\u0022, comenta Francisco, de 48 años, que reconoce en broma que si fuera a ligar al súper su mujer le pegaría. \u0022Para eso están los bares de copas, yo no ligaría así\u0022, apunta como sitio perfecto donde conocer un posible amor. \u0022Yo estoy casada y tengo un niño, no voy buscando nada\u0022, cuenta Bárbara, de 44 años. \u0022Debo ser de otra generación, a mí me gustaba salir a un bar y las miraditas... un amigo te presenta a alguien... si vengo y alguien me choca el carro me daría la vuelta\u0022, añade. Esto también tiene nombre: el carrito cobra. Aunque no debe ser cuestión de generación. Zoe tan solo tiene 24 años y reconoce que no le crea ninguna curiosidad. \u0022Si a la gente le ayuda hacer esto para conocer gente... es una forma original de ligar pero no buena\u0022, afirma, a la vez que pone de manifiesto que al supermercado se va, simplemente, a hacer la compra. \u0022Si me chocan el carro seguramente ni me daría cuenta\u0022. Ignacio, de 56 años, se alinea con la mayoría de las opiniones. \u0022Esto es una tontería\u0022, dice rotundo y reconoce que si alguien le diera con el carro no haría nada, \u0022no me daría por aludido\u0022. Para él, como para la mayoría, lo mejor es \u0022ligar en los bares o en las redes sociales\u0022. Parece que la moda de Mercadona, a la que se han apuntado otros supermercados como Lidl o Carrefour, no llega a calar hondo en los ciudadanos. Eso sí, las piñas están sufriendo la oleada de sorpresivos influencers haciendo el vídeo de la semana.
